abstract: More than 12 states, including California and Vermont, have adopted laws allowing for new type of company that combines aspects of nonprofit and for-profit corporations; so-called flexible-purpose corporations can tap into conventional capital markets as well as philanthropy.
snippet: More than 12 states have passed laws allowing companies to emphasize social benefits more than profit, bridging the gap between businesses and nonprofits.
lead_paragraph: More than 12 states have passed laws allowing companies to emphasize social benefits more than profit, bridging the gap between businesses and nonprofits.

headline.main: A Quest for Hybrid Companies That Profit, but Can Tap Charity
